page.title: 09Farming in Aston
page.content: In Aston there are four farms North, New South, Turnshaw and Nickerwood. North owns 150 acres, New South 100, Turnshaw 32.5 and Nickerwood 140. North farms{crops}are winter wheat, winter barley, spring barley, grass (silage) & rape. New South grows barley, wheat, pigeon bean & rape. Turnshaw grows grass and rape. Nickerwood grows wheat, potatoes, barley swedes and rape. Turnshaw is the only{farm}that has{livestock} although all have dogs and North might be having some bull calves. Turnshaw has 23 cows, 16 heifers and 2 bull calves. New Souths oldest building is 10 years old while Norths,Turnshaws and Nickerwoods oldest buildings are 200 to 300 years old. Nickerwood lost 30{acres}when the M1 was built and 5 with the Bypass. D.B.&T.C.
